Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Calli was not my TF, but SIS is making me select a TF to submit this evaluation and Calli is the only option.

Calli was a magnificent TF, knowledgeable, kind, and attentive. She is a thoughtful and close reader of course work, an encouraging voice in her feedback and in her teaching and facilitation. She is great at what she does!
Calli is amazing!
Mr. Choi
Calli included the entire class in discussions and made sure we understood the difficult readings and material.

She is the best TA I've ever had. She was approachable and insightfully answered our questions during our sections and outside of the class. I felt like she genuinely cared that we understand and learn the materials.

Calli ran really organized sectioned, which ideas clearly set out on the board. This was a difficult class, and she found ways for us to organize the material so that we might better understand the arguments.
David Choi
David Choi.

David Choi: David was an earnest TA but his own personal views on what he thinks Christianity is often foreclosed discussion about what Christian ethics could be. It was interesting to have section with him though seeing as how I will need to engage in conversation with people who hold fairly traditional views of the Christian tradition. I didn't necessarily trust his judgment in fairly assessing my work though. I also wasn't a big fan of the way he seemed to make assumptions that the students in section embraced the Christian tradition. I could see him wanting to bring a pastoral sensibility to his role as a TA but that is not what I wanted from this class or section. I did not want a pastor. I wanted a person who would wrestle with the content with us.
Calli Micale
Callie.
Calli Micale
Calli Micale
Calli Micale

Cali

Cali was one of the most supportive and thought provoking section leaders that I have worked with at YDS. She was able to frame complex ideas to enhance our understanding and she managed to engage an exceptionally divergent group into a cohesive community.  

Her written feedback was excellent, detailed, critical, and supportive.  I would be eager to study with Cali again.
Weakness - assessing work from a variety of faith traditions.

David was the worst section leader I have had. He was not familiar with the subject matter in a way that allowed him to lead a section well; he did not have strong leadership skills that allowed him to lead a discussion group; he was extremely critical on our papers in a way that gave us worse grades than the other TF's sections; he did a poor job in making non-Christian students feel welcome and included in the class; he was very unfamiliar with any ethicists who were not white men. I really hope David is not asked back... unfortunately he ruined this course for me.

Calli was a great teaching fellow. She asked us to rigorously engage with the texts, and gave us helpful strategies for approaching different thinkers, tracking their arguments, and putting them in conversation with one another.
She is a great teacher. She brought a lot of order to a very disorganized course. My only suggestion is that she does not need to be so loud in small rooms.

Calli gave very helpful feedback on our assignments. It's clear she really spent time reading them and giving constructive feedback. She also helped anchor us within the shifting sands of the class by giving us background information, etc. My favorite thing she taught us was how to take notes on different thinkers for the final. The framework she gave us was extremely helpful for reviewing everything we had read and for organizing my thoughts for the take-home.

Calli Micale prompted excellent discussions in our section meetings. These were lively conversations. I may have been less conversational (certainly less insightful) than some others, who seemed to grasp the material earlier in the course than I.  Calli is an engaging personality, wizard-smart, with a light touch. She kept the conversation going whenever they needed a kick-start. Her preparation for the take-home final was a life-saver. She took us through how to outline the position of a given ethicist: what is the problem? How did the ethicist deal with it?..etc. This focused us on that position, then allowed us to compare/contrast with others.  Her feedback on our two papers was detailed, constructive and timely. I will miss being with her next year.

Calli was phenomenal and was extremely accessible and helpful. As a doctoral student, I can see that she is finding her method in the lecturing and teaching. However, she was transparent in her knowledge and her
